Experienced in creating new opportunities by thinking out of the box.

profile_positions.description: Class is changing the way the world learns - it has everything you need to facilitate virtual learning, from videos and polls to quizzes and collaborative working space. Class helps you keep learner focus and engagement, with websites, files, videos, and more in one place.
profile_positions.title: Director of Operations and Account Management EMEA & LAC

profile_positions.description:
Turnitin is a global SaaS company dedicated to ensuring the integrity of education and research and supporting the development of original thinking skills. 

As a Team Lead I am managing  the business conducted trough the VARs in the EMEA region - to ensure that their compliance and further development of the business. Supporting them to execute on mutually agreed Business and Marketing planning. Working together with them in developing their customer base, representing our solutions on industry events and virtually, adopting new solutions on their markets and generating new leads.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead, Sr Channel Business Development Manager

profile_positions.description:
Blackboard is the leading education technology partner of most of the world’s leading Universities and Higher Education Institutions.

Responsibilities: 
•	Provide support, leadership and direction on resellers / partners  who will own relationships at their country locations.
•	Develop strong C-level relationships with managed partners to drive commitment to Blackboard products and solutions.
•	Supporting Partnership growth in sales and signing new profitable partnerships
•	Grow net new partner revenue through joint business, pipeline and forecast planning and execution
•	Collaborate closely with Blackboard Sales teams and leadership on partner business opportunities and escalations
•	Responsible for driving partner success by managing, developing and growing all aspects of the partner relationship to drive revenue across 
•	Executing a solid and aggressive partner development strategy and driving incremental revenue opportunities through the development of joint solutions at a regional level
•	Pipeline management & forecasting across Blackboard-led opportunities and net new partner-sourced business.
•	Program and project management - related to Partner Sales and Marketing enablement
•	Leverage Cross-Functional team of specialists to drive enablement and marketing activities for partner training and marketing execution activities – Solution Architects, Channel Programs, Channel Marketing.
•	Growing Channel sales with over $ 1M year-over-year
•	Organising partner trainings and creating reporting and dashboards on partner results within Salesforce.com
•	Managing overall Partner Relationships - new partner recruitment, training and on-boarding
profile_positions.title: International Channel Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Client Manager of the Year award for 2011 and member of the Blackboard CEO Club 

Responsibilities: 
•	Organising customer focused events and forums in all the regions. Managing the events budget and owning the ROI results from each event
•	Managing the customer license renewals at $8,5M value
•	Driving collaboration between clients to support their success
•	Working with Channel Partners to support the client renewals business
•	Driving client communication on product developments, pricing and company acquisitions
•	Working with the Sales teams to increase volume of sales 
•	CRM management and reporting to leadership team
profile_positions.title: Senior Client Manager EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: 
•	Organising customer focused events and forums in all the regions. 
•	Managing the events budget and owning the ROI results from each event
•	Successfully manage the customer license renewals and upsells
•	Drive the collaboration between clients to support their success
•	Drive client communication on product developments, pricing fluctuations and company acquisitions
•	Working with the Sales Teams to drive business, upsell, renewals and providing them with enablement and training
•	CRM management and reporting to company management

Achievements:
o	Assisting with the annual flagship Blackboard Teaching & Learning Conference 2009 with 450+ attendees and receiving the prize for highest number of personal clients brought to the event
o	Organising the 1st successful Blackboard Client Day for the UK Further Education market at Middlesbrough College
o	Setting up two Regional Trainings in Aston & London for the UK clients (3 days, with 40 participants each which was record attendance)
o	Assisted with the brand new User group in the NW (Liverpool) region
o	End-to-end managed a very successful Benelux Blackboard User Group Day at University of Amsterdam delivering 23 net new leads leading to 3 deals of between $300-$800k
profile_positions.title: Client Manager UK and Ireland

profile_positions.description:
IBM SPSS Statistics is an integrated family of products that helps to address the entire analytical process, from planning and data collection to analysis, reporting and deployment. 

Responsibilities:
•	Selling SPSS products to clients from different sectors
•	Converting leads generated by the Marketing team into actual sales
•	Organising webinars and supply Marketing materials to support customer success
profile_positions.title: Account Manager SPSS

profile_positions.description:
Hoist Group develops and supplies systems, products and services to independent hotels and hotel chains, hospitals and public venues. 

Responsibilities:
•	Managing clients (hotels and event centers) in the Benelux region 
•	Assisting with numerous marketing campaigns and organising company events 
•	Creating conference quotes, advising meeting organisers, making proposals, and after-sales account management
•	Training clients on company products and the online tools provided
•	Daily support of the Benelux Sales team including multilevel selling and managing complex sales cycles
•	CRM management and looking for potentially valuable sales leads
profile_positions.title: Account Manager

profile_positions.description:
Hilton Amsterdam hotel is a luxury 5* property, famous for John Lennon and Yoko Ono's 1969 ‘bed-in for peace' and Hilton's first hotel in the Netherlands.

Responsibilities:
•	Coaching and supervising the Front Office team
•	Rolling-out various improvements to aid team productiveness, focus on staff training and development
•	Ensure the maximization of customer satisfaction and revenue generation
•	Communicate effectively with customers, team-members and other departments in the hotel
•	Write different procedures concerning Front Desk operations (included in SOP)
•	Deliver Loyalty program benefits and encourage the team to promote it
•	Act as a Night Manager and prepare different reports for the hotel management
•	Meet individual and team targets as set by the Front Desk Manager
•	Mange daily operations, resolve customer complaints, liaise with other departments
•	Deliver Sales and Job Skills Trainings (Up-selling Training, Customer Care Training, Complaints handling and Body Language Trainings) –in all Hilton hotels in the Netherlands 
•	Maintain customer relations with regular guests and handle customer complaints to achieve full guest satisfaction
profile_positions.title: Front Office Team Lead and Departmental Trainer

profile_positions.company: Hilton Prague & Hilton Prague Old Town
profile_positions.description:
One of the biggest 5* convention hotels within Europe, offering 38 meeting rooms, ballroom, 788 guest rooms, well-known spa and restaurants.

Responsibilities:
•	Acting team leader and a coach for a team over 25 staff members (holding different trainings for the Front Office and Reservation Departments)
•	Maximize Sales at the Front Desk through up-selling and identifying sales leads
•	Setting demanding but realistic targets and methods of achieving them
•	Communicating and liaising with other departments
•	Managing overbooking with view to optimize revenue
•	Delivering loyalty program benefits and encouraging the team to promote it
•	Ensure that the team complies with the company credit policy
•	Communicate goals, vision and company values to the team
•	Prepare and conduct departmental meetings
•	Maintain positive working environment among the team
•	Manning of Front Office staff - preparing work schedules and attendance sheets for pay-roll
•	Managing daily operations - set extra stations and automate process for group arrivals
•	Liaise and assist event organizers throughout events taking place at the property
•	Participating in leadership meetings
•	Dealing with customer complains and maintaining high level of company brand standards
profile_positions.title: Assistant Front Desk Manager & Front Office Departmental Trainer

profile_positions.description:
A luxury 5* hotel located in the hearth of the Bulgaria's capital Sofia. Preferred place to stay for business travelers, families and attendees of the conferences or events taking place in the hotel.

Responsibilities:
•	Liaise between Front Desk Manager and Front Office staff
•	Responsible of maintaining high company standards by all staff
•	Identify training needs and conduct training of staff when required
•	Carry out a maximization of revenue by communicating up-selling possibilities
•	Carry out the supervision of the Front desk agents, Bell desk and Drivers and ensure the correct implementation of daily activities
•	Maximization of guest services by personal input
•	Comply departmental work schedule according to business trends
•	Carry out book-outs when necessary; take measured risk with overbooking the hotel
•	Liaise with Reservations, F&B and Housekeeping Departments as per guest requirements and maintain healthy work atmosphere
•	Monitor daily arrivals and ensure room allocation according to preferences
•	Acting Duty Manager over weekends and after office hours
profile_positions.title: Front Desk Shift Leader & Front Office Departmental Trainer

profile_positions.description: Hospitality Management Internship during the 4th year of my study.

profile_positions.description:
Work next to study
International tourist agent  in charge of hotel reservations in Greece, Turkey, Cyprus and Malta
• Booking flights, applying for visas on behalf of clients, assisting in preparing all necessary documents for the clients` trips
• Booking accommodation for congress delegates also in the city of Sofia, Bulgaria. 
• Signing-up new locations as holiday destinations, negotiate on seasonal pricing with hotel management
• Consult clients on the trip destinations of their choice
• Managing relationships with hotels being sold by the agency
profile_positions.title: Travel Agent

volunteer_experiences.description:
Work as an interpreter for Bulgarian nurses, sent to the Netherlands on medical training courses by the Ministry of Healthcare in Bulgaria. Done 4 years in a row between 1995 - 1998.
Uitleencentrum Noorderhaven in Julianadorp, The Netherlands deals with mentally and physically handicap patients - the training of the nurses had the aim to give the skills to deal with such patients and ensure they can improve the quality of patient`s life.
